column2: Those who direct, those who consent, and those who carry out an act share in its fruit, whether it is heaven or hell, but those who are more closely involved with the act receive a larger share of the fruit.
Marital Property The husband and wife have joint control over their property.
With their consent and for their benefit, others also may tend to it.

column2: Judicial Process Men who are learned, of good family, elderly, wise, and unwavering in their duties shall adjudicate lawsuits, in doubtful cases investigating the matter by examining the evidence and using ordeals.

column1: puṇyāhe prātar agnāv iddhe 'apāmante rājavaty ubhayataḥ samākhyāpya sarvaanumate mukhyaḥ satyaṃ praśnaṃ brūyāt /
column2: Witnesses In the morning of an auspicious day and in the presence of a blazing fire, water, and the king, both sides should be asked to present their case and, with everyones approval, the chief witness should answer the questions truthfully.

column1: anṛte rājā daṇḍaṃ praṇayet / narakaś caatraadhikaḥ sāṃparāye /
column2: Should he answer untruthfully, the king should punish him and in addition hell awaits him after death.
Should he answer truthfully, he will go to heaven and all beings will sing his praises.

column1: sā niṣṭhā yā vidyā strīṣu śūdreṣu ca / ātharvaṇasya vedasya śeṣa ity upadiśanti /
column2: CONCLUSION OF THE STUDY OF LAW The knowledge found among women and Śūdras forms the conclusion, and they point out that it is a subsidiary component of the Atharva Veda.
It is difficult to gain mastery of the Law by means of scriptures alone, but by acting according to the markers one can master it.

column1: tatra lakṣaṇam / sarvajanapadeṣv ekāntasamāhitam āryāṇāṃ vṛttaṃ samyagvinītānāṃ vṛddhānām ātmavatām alolupānām adāmbhikānāṃ vṛttasādṛśyaṃ bhajeta /
column2: And the markers in this case are as follows he should model his conduct after that which is unanimously approved in all regions by Aryas who have been properly trained, who are elderly and selfpossessed, and who are neither greedy nor deceitful.
In this way he will win both worlds .

column2: According to some, one should learn the remaining Laws from women and people of all classes.
That concludes the Apastamba Dharmasūtra.
